summary: genome ANNOUNCEMENT Porcine epidemic diarrhea virus (PEDV) is an enveloped virus with a single-stranded, positive-sense RNA genome of about 30 kb (10, 12) PEDV infection causes porcine epidemic diarrhea, an enteric disease characterized by acute watery diarrhea, dehydration, vomiting, and high mortality in nursery piglets (9, 10) complete genome sequence of AJ1102 is 28,035 nucleotides (nt) in length, excluding the poly(A) tail. the organization of the genome of AJ1102 is similar to that of other reported PEDV genomes. the genome sequence of PEDV strain AJ1102 has been deposited in GenBank under the accession number JX188454.
